column4: anyway. i am trying to install ubuntu on my machine. however, my install CD's wont boot(i have tried 4 now, Ubuntu 64, ubuntu 64-alternate, xubuntu and ye, Mint(i mention it since its based on ubuntu). MD5sum them all, all checked out. tried acpi=off, etc etc
after you burn, can you see dirs and files on the cd?
what does your computer do when you try to boot to the disc?
sorry, i dc'ed, did i miss anything?
I just asked what it does when you try to boot to that disc
so the disc itself is booting, it's just having video issues
i tried the ubuntu64 text version, same problem
that's a weird issue.  you might try pressing ctrl+alt+F2 after it seems hung to see if you get in a text console.
what vid card do you have?
- im gonna try the alt-ctrl-f2 to see if i get a console up, so leaving chat
no dice, i tried "check installation medium" when the cd boots, and same problem
have you tried the alternative install disc?
infact, thats the one i tried now
I am out of ideas.  It's tough to figure out when not there first hand, you know?
depends on what filesystem it is already
